meanings.definition: To strike or hit with a heavy club or similar weapon.
meanings.sent1: He bludgeoned the nail into the wood with a hammer.
meanings.sent2: The criminal was arrested for bludgeoning the victim with a bat.
meanings.sent3: The chef bludgeoned the dough to make the perfect bread.
meanings.sent4: Her words bludgeoned his heart, leaving him broken.
meanings.sent5: The storm bludgeoned the coast, causing widespread damage.

meanings.definition: The act of using a heavy club or similar weapon to strike or hit someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The bludgeoning of the door with a sledgehammer was heard throughout the house.
meanings.sent2: The detective found evidence of bludgeoning at the crime scene.
meanings.sent3: The pillow fight turned into a playful bludgeoning match.
meanings.sent4: The bludgeoning of the drums in the band added a powerful rhythm to the music.
meanings.sent5: The bludgeoning of the gavel signaled the end of the court session.
